I was in the middle of saying sorry here and bumping into another moving wall there, when I noticed a new order in the air. A white bus parked. The occupants jumped down. And Ikeja was painted into another colour of tumult. People ran here and there, some disappeared like a flash, some rooted like Iroko by consterna- tion. And thenewcomers, the bringers ofadarkly-complexioned chaos, scam- pered after their quarries, wielding guns, flinging kobokos. They were men of the task force. They had the task of a snake cut in the middle, and the force of an enraged, hungry lion. The Security and Exchange Com- mission is agovernment parastatal whose duty generally is to regu- late the operations of the Capital Market. Where a case of gross violation of the rule of the game by a capital market operator is established, SEC is empowered to invoke appropriate sanctions on the erring operator. Inherent in all this Is that, SEC, along with The Nigerian Stock Exchange ,(NSE) has the responsibility to protect the investing public. Around December 1992, the Middle East Bank of Dubai, former technical patners of Owena Bank Plc left the bank, having ended their technical agreement with it. The exit also meant that the technical partners' 10.25 per cent shareholding in the bank amounting to 12.3 million share was available for sale to the bank's existingshareholders and other inter- ested investors.
